name: Medium Cheddar Cheese Sauce (Live, Raw, and Vegan)
author: Lady Miss Jme
summary: Everyone (well, almost!) loves cheese sauce over veggies, or for dipping. But of course there are all the pitfalls of eating cow dairy products. Here is a raw, live, vegan alternative that really stands up for applause! Serve over gently chopped broccoli (food processor may over-chop and thus juice your broccoli!), chopped asparagus, and any other food you would normally top with a cheese sauce. This is also a fabulous dip, room temp or cold. Take a walk on the alive food side...
ingredients: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Place cashews in a large bowl
Pour enough water over cashews to cover
Cover the bowl and soak cashews overnight, at least 12 hours
Drain the water from cashews; place cashews in a blender
For a tangier cheddar flavor add 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice to cashews
Pour enough water to come to 1/4-inch below of the top of the cashews
Place nutritional yeast, onion, sunflower seed oil, salt, garlic powder, tamari sauce, turmeric, and cayenne pepper in blender
